messages.subject: Re: Huge tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: Rich/Milt: I don t have it here (to measure the thickness) but it is thin. On the attribution, everyone is lining up for Mito/Shoami. I see a hint of late
messages.messageBody:
Rich/Milt:

I don't have it here (to measure the thickness) but it is thin.

On the attribution, everyone is lining up for Mito/Shoami.
I see a hint of late Kaneie school...see p175 (if I recall) in the
Kodogu volume of the Nihon To Koza but I guess I am seing what I want
to see... :)

Thanks,
Ron

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Huge tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/28/2003 9:24:19 AM Central Daylight Time, ikkanshi@westnet.com.au writes: Cool piece Ron, nice theme, is it very thick, I kind of guess it
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/28/2003 9:24:19 AM Central Daylight Time,
ikkanshi@... writes:
Cool piece Ron, nice theme, is it very thick, I kind of guess it is thin by
the look of it. Sh么ami ?.

Rich
----- Original Message -----
From: Ron Polansky
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, August 28, 2003 7:44 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Huge tsuba


Hello, All:

I came across an interesting tsuba:
http://www.nihontophile.com/DragTsu1.jpg
http://www.nihontophile.com/DragTsu2.jpg
Condition, work seem to place it mid (or most probably) late Edo.
Very slight seppa zuri indicate it was mounted up.
Tsuba is 3 7/8" tall x 3 3/4" wide. Were "big" tsuba popular in late
Edo? (I thought not..) I wonder what size of blade this would have
been mounted on?..definitely not a "dainty" piece...

Thanks,
Ron P.

I cast the vote for Mito...............

-M


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Huge tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: Cool piece Ron, nice theme, is it very thick, I kind of guess it is thin by the look of it. Sh么ami ?. Rich ... From: Ron Polansky To:
messages.messageBody:
Cool piece Ron, nice theme, is it very thick, I kind of guess it is thin by the look of it. Sh么ami ?.

Rich
----- Original Message -----
From: Ron Polansky
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, August 28, 2003 7:44 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Huge tsuba


Hello, All:

I came across an interesting tsuba:
http://www.nihontophile.com/DragTsu1.jpg
http://www.nihontophile.com/DragTsu2.jpg
Condition, work seem to place it mid (or most probably) late Edo.
Very slight seppa zuri indicate it was mounted up.
Tsuba is 3 7/8" tall x 3 3/4" wide. Were "big" tsuba popular in late
Edo? (I thought not..) I wonder what size of blade this would have
been mounted on?..definitely not a "dainty" piece...

Thanks,
Ron P.
